alert.note: Alert for Middlesex; Monmouth; Ocean (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued March 28 at 2:32PM EDT until March 28 at 3:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 300 PM EDT FOR NORTHEASTERN OCEAN...MONMOUTH AND SOUTHEASTERN MIDDLESEX COUNTIES... At 231 PM EDT, a dangerous snow squall was located over Ramtown, or 8 miles north of Toms River, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts up to 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect hazardous road conditions. This includes the following highways... Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 16 and 34. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 88 and 109. Locations impacted include... Toms River, Long Branch, Asbury Park, Lakewood, Jackson, Howell, Marlboro, Manalapan, Tinton Falls, Manasquan, Point Pleasant Beach, Farmingdale, Mantoloking, Allenwood, East Freehold, Six Flags Theme Park, West Freehold, Adelphia, Vista Center and Yorketown. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. Wet roadways will quickly freeze. Black ice will cause roads, bridges and overpasses to become slick and dangerous. Slow down and be prepared for sudden loss of traction.
